instruction: Explain why carrots are good for you
output: Carrots are a good source of several essential nutrients, including beta-carotene, fiber, vitamin K1, and potassium. Beta-carotene is an antioxidant that helps protect your body from damage caused by harmful molecules, fiber helps with digestion and may have other health benefits, vitamin K1 helps form blood clots, and potassium helps regulate blood pressure. Eating carrots may also have health benefits such as improved vision, healthy skin and hair, and a lower risk of heart disease.
